docs.lead_paragraph: The chief of Turing Pharmaceuticals, who increased a drug’s price to $750 from $13.50 a pill, has been bashed as the face of corporate greed. But he’s still smiling.

headline.main: Martin Shkreli, the Bad Boy of Pharmaceuticals, Hits Back
headline.print_headline: The Bad Boy of Pharmaceuticals Hits Back

docs.snippet: The chief of Turing Pharmaceuticals, who increased a drug’s price to $750 from $13.50 a pill, has been bashed as the face of corporate greed. But he’s still smiling.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL and ANDREW POLLACK

docs.lead_paragraph: Indian authorities were investigating possible negligence after 18 hospital patients died when rainwaters from massive floods in southern Tamil Nadu state knocked out generators and switched off ventilators.

headline.main: India Officials Investigate Negligence After 18 Patients Die
headline.print_headline: India Officials Investigate Negligence After 18 Patients Die

docs.snippet: Indian authorities were investigating possible negligence after 18 hospital patients died when rainwaters from massive floods in southern Tamil Nadu state knocked out generators and switched off ventilators.

docs.lead_paragraph: The announcement that Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief, and his wife would give away billions of dollars drew hundreds of responses from New York Times readers about the causes they’d support.

headline.main: If Readers Had $45 Billion to Donate, This Is What They Would Support

docs.snippet: The announcement that Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief, and his wife would give away billions of dollars drew hundreds of responses from New York Times readers about the causes they’d support.

byline.original: Compiled by THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's biggest pharmacy benefits manager is muscling back into the debate over soaring drug costs by promoting a less-expensive alternative to a life-saving medicine with a list price of $750 per pill.

headline.main: Express Scripts Offers Low-Cost Alternative to Turing Drug
headline.print_headline: Express Scripts Offers Low-Cost Alternative to Turing Drug

docs.snippet: The nation's biggest pharmacy benefits manager is muscling back into the debate over soaring drug costs by promoting a less-expensive alternative to a life-saving medicine with a list price of $750 per pill.
